title: Poll Position
text:
This week:

Former Trump campaign manager Corey Lewandowski was grilled on Capitol Hill this week. Lewandowski testified before the House Judiciary Committee in its first impeachment probe hearing on his contact with the president in regards to the Russia investigation. Senior Capitol Hill producer Chad Pergram recaps this week's hearing with Jared.

President Trump announced that Robert C. O'Brien will be his new National Security Advisor. O'Brien who served as the president's special envoy for hostage affairs will be the president's fourth national security adviser replacing John Bolton who left the White House abruptly last week. FOX's D.C. Correspondent Rachel Sutherland spoke with FOX's White House Correspondent Jon Decker about the new national security adviser.

It's still unclear who the new Prime Minister of Israel is. Longtime Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu is facing an uphill battle to hold on to his job to rival Benny Gantz. Netanyahu, who is facing charges of corruption and bribery, could face jail time if he is not elected prime minister and able to pass an immunity law. Jared spoke with on Israel's former Ambassador to the United Nations Ron Prosor how this election can impact the USA relationship with Israel.

While the Democratic presidential field remains large it seems like it is becoming a three-person race between former Vice President Joe Biden who is leading in the polls. Followed by Senator Elizabeth Warren and Senator Bernie Sanders. Jared discusses the latest polls with FOX News pollster Daron Shaw.

description: This week, former Trump campaign manager Corey Lewandowski testified before the House Judiciary Committee, President Trump has a new National Security Advisor and new polls are out.
